channel.copyright: Copyright 2025 BLOOMBERG L.P. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED

item.title: China Accuses US of Undermining Trade Talks With Warnings Against Huawei Chips
item.description: The Chinese government accused the Trump administration of undermining recent trade talks in Geneva after it warned that using Huawei Technologies Co.’s artificial-intelligence chips “anywhere in the world” would violate US export controls.
item.dc:creator: Olivia Tam, Debby Wu

media:content.media:description: A corporate logo sits on a Huawei Technologies Co. NetEngine 8000 intelligent metro router on display during a 5G event in London, U.K., on Thursday, Feb. 20, 2020. Huawei said at the event it currently has 91 contracts for 5G, with 47 of those in Europe.

item.title: Nintendo Turns to Samsung to Make Chips, Ramp Up Switch 2 Output
item.description: Nintendo Co. has turned to Samsung Electronics Co. to help make the main chips for the Switch 2, a move that may help the Japanese company ramp up production of the gaming console enough to sell a higher-than-projected 20 million units by March 2026.
item.dc:creator: Yoolim Lee, Takashi Mochizuki

media:content.media:description: The Switch 2 at a launch event in Paris on April 2. Photographer: Dimitar Dilkoff/AFP/Getty Images

item.title: US-India Trade Deal Unlikely to be Major Market Driver, Bernstein Says
item.description: Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:
item.dc:creator: Ashutosh Joshi

item.title: CATL Rises in HK Debut After World’s Top Listing This Year
item.description: Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd. rose in its Hong Kong trading debut after the Chinese battery giant wrapped up the world’s biggest listing this year by raising HK$35.7 billion ($4.6 billion) despite being blacklisted by the Pentagon and grinding through geopolitical storms.
item.dc:creator: Charlotte Yang

media:content.media:description: CATL Chairman Robin Zeng strikes a gong at the listing ceremony in Hong Kong. Photographer: Paul Yeung/Bloomberg

item.title: Bithumb Claims Larger Slice of Korea’s Crypto Space Ahead of IPO
item.description: After years spent in the shadow of larger rival Upbit, crypto exchange Bithumb is clawing back a more meaningful share of South Korea’s tightly held digital-assets market.
item.dc:creator: Sidhartha Shukla

item.title: Trump’s Mideast Chips Deals Imperil US National Security, Democrats Warn
item.description: Key Senate Democrats urged the Trump administration to revisit new artificial intelligence deals with Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates, saying that expanded sales of AI chips to the Middle Eastern countries risk exposing advanced technology to China and Russia, while potentially limiting supplies available for American companies.
item.dc:creator: Michael Shepard

media:content.media:description: Senator Elizabeth Warren, a Democrat from Massachusetts and ranking member of Senate Banking committee, co-signed a letter to top Trump administration officials expressing concern that recent AI deals in the Mideast would jeopardize US national security and economic competitiveness.

item.title: Nvidia Opens AI Ecosystem to Rivals, Apple AI Struggles | Bloomberg Technology
item.description: Bloomberg’s Ed Ludlow breaks down why the Magnificent Seven are lower on Monday as investor sentiment sours more broadly following Moody’s US credit downgrade. Plus, Nvidia says it will allow customers to use rival chipmakers in an effort to expand its AI ecosystem, and Apple has been spending billions of dollars on AI but insiders say it still can't get it right. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Thoma Bravo Nears Deal for Insurance Tech Firm Itel
item.description: Buyout firm Thoma Bravo is in advanced talks to acquire to acquire GTCR-backed Itel, an insurance technology firm focused on property and casualty claims services, according to people with knowledge of the matter.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Gould

media:content.media:description: Signage at the Thoma Bravo private equity firm in the Brickell neighborhood of Miami, Florida, US, on Wednesday, March 5, 2025. Since the current iteration of Thoma Bravo was founded in 2008, it's been involved in roughly a fifth of all private equity buyouts in the sector as measured by value, according to data compiled by Bloomberg. Photographer: Scott McIntyre/Bloomberg

item.title: Pony AI Earnings Put Investors on Alert for Robotaxi Expansion
item.description: Pony AI Inc.’s report on its first full quarter as a publicly traded company will have investors and analysts homing in on how a new generation of robotaxis could put the firm on a path to profitability.
item.dc:creator: Natalia Kniazhevich

media:content.media:description: A Pony.ai Inc. autonomous vehicle with the branding of the World Artificial Intelligence Conference (WAIC) travels along a road in Shanghai, China, on Thursday, July 8, 2021. The conference runs through to July 10.

item.title: Google Decided Against Offering Publishers Options in AI Search
item.description: Company drew “hard red line” around requiring web publishers to participate in AI search, document says
item.dc:creator: Davey Alba, Julia Love

media:content.media:description: Signage at the the Google headquarters in Mountain View, California, US, on Thursday, Oct. 10, 2024. Alphabet Inc. is scheduled to release earnings figures on October 24. Photographer David Paul Morris/Bloomberg

item.title: US Battery Startup ONE Inks Production Deal With Turkey’s Pomega
item.description: US battery startup Our Next Energy Inc. will outsource some production of its battery cells to Turkey’s Pomega Enerji Depolama Teknolojileri AS.
item.dc:creator: Patrick Sykes

media:content.media:description: UKRAINE - 2022/01/06: In this photo illustration, Our Next Energy Inc. (ONE) logo seen displayed on a smartphone screen. (Photo Illustration by Pavlo Gonchar/SOPA Images/LightRocket via Getty Images)

item.title: Lyft Revives Pooled Rides at Airports in Push for Cheaper Trips
item.description: Lyft Inc. is bringing back cheaper shared trips at airports, reversing a decision made two years ago to discontinue the ride option as it seeks to compete with rival Uber Technologies Inc. in courting inflation-weary consumers.
item.dc:creator: Natalie Lung

media:content.media:description: Passengers wait for rides from Lyft Inc. at the LAX-it centralized pickup area at Los Angeles International Airport (LAX) in Los Angeles, California, U.S., on Tuesday, Oct. 29, 2019. On Tuesday, Los Angeles International Airport's ban on Uber, Lyft, and taxi curbside pickup went into effect while the airport ramps up work on its modernization program. Photographer: Patrick T. Fallon/Bloomberg

item.title: Apple Must Resolve ‘Fortnite’ Return or Answer for It to Judge
item.description: Apple Inc. will have to answer to a judge for refusing to restore Fortnite to its US App Store if it hasn’t resolved its standoff with Epic Games Inc. by May 27.
item.dc:creator: Josh Sisco, Mark Gurman

media:content.media:description: The Epic Games Inc. Fortnite: Battle Royale video game is seen in the App Store on an Apple Inc. iPhone displayed for a photograph in Washington, D.C., U.S., on Thursday, May 10, 2018. Fortnite, the hit game that's denting the stock prices of video-game makers after signing up 45 million players, didn't really take off until it became free and a free-for-all.

item.title: Rio Tinto Strikes Another Lithium Deal With Codelco Venture
item.description: Rio Tinto Group agreed to invest in a Chilean lithium project controlled by Codelco as the world’s second-biggest miner continues its expansion into the battery metal.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Biesheuvel

item.title: Microsoft Is Bringing Elon Musk’s AI Models to Its Cloud
item.description: Microsoft Corp. is adding models from Elon Musk’s xAI to its artificial intelligence marketplace.
item.dc:creator: Matt Day, Brody Ford

media:content.media:description: The Grok logo on a laptop computer arranged in New York, US, on Wednesday, Nov. 8, 2023. Elon Musk revealed his own artificial intelligence bot, dubbed Grok, claiming the prototype is already superior to ChatGPT 3.5 across several benchmarks.

item.title: Nvidia Opens AI Ecosystem to Rival Chipmakers in Global Push
item.description: Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang outlined plans to let customers deploy rival chips in data centers built around its technology, a move that acknowledges the growth of in-house semiconductor development by major clients such as Microsoft Corp. and Amazon.com Inc.
item.dc:creator: Vlad Savov, Ian King, Jane Lanhee Lee

media:content.media:description: Jensen Huang at Computex in Taipei on May 19. Photographer: Annabelle Chih/Bloomberg

item.title: Aramco, Saudi Telecom Join Sequoia in Backing US-Based Startup Graphiant
item.description: The venture capital arms of Saudi Arabia’s oil and telecom giants have invested in US tech startup Graphiant Inc. as the kingdom seeks to drive innovation and develop its digital economy.
item.dc:creator: Fahad Abuljadayel

media:content.media:description: Computer source code programmer script developer. Modern technology background. Web software. Source: maciek905/iStockphoto

item.title: Salesforce Cuts Slack Price for US Government, Following Google
item.description: Salesforce Inc. will offer its Slack application to the federal government at a discounted rate, the latest software company to cut prices as the Trump administration aims to slash technology costs.
item.dc:creator: Brody Ford, Gregory Korte

media:content.media:description: The Slack Technologies Inc. application is displayed in the App Store on an Apple Inc. iPhone in an arranged photograph taken in Arlington, Virginia, U.S. on Monday, April 29, 2019. Slack's filing last week confirms its plans to avoid a traditional public offering and instead list its shares directly on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol SK. Photographer: Andrew Harrer/Bloomberg

item.title: China Says US Chip Controls Are Undermining Trade Consensus
item.description: China sees the US as undermining the consensus reached between the two countries during trade talks in Geneva, a spokesperson for the Asian nation’s commerce ministry says.
item.dc:creator: Olivia Tam

item.title: Chipmaker AMD Agrees to Sell AI Server Assets to Sanmina
item.description: Sanmina Corp. is buying Advanced Micro Devices Inc.’s AI server assembly plants in a deal worth as much as $3 billion.
item.dc:creator: Dana Wollman, Ryan Gould, Jane Lanhee Lee

media:content.media:description: The Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) headquarters in Santa Clara, California, US, on Friday, Jan. 31, 2025. Advanced Micro Devices Inc. is scheduled to release earnings figures on February 4.

item.title: Apple Partner Hon Hai Injects $1.5 Billion Into India Unit
item.description: Hon Hai Precision Industry Co., the main manufacturer of Apple Inc.’s iPhones, will inject $1.5 billion into its India unit as production shifts away from China.
item.dc:creator: Twinnie Siu

media:content.media:description: Employees work on an assembly line in the mobile phone plant of Rising Stars Mobile India Pvt., a unit of Foxconn Technology Co., in Sriperumbudur, Tamil Nadu, India, on Friday, July 12, 2019. Foxconn, also known as Hon Hai Precision Industry Co., opened its first India factory four years ago, it now operates two assembly plants with plans to expand those and open two more. The company was integral to China’s transformation into a manufacturing colossus, and founder Terry Gou has told India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi that Foxconn could help India do the same. Photographer: Karen Dias/Bloomberg

item.title: Nvidia, UAE’s MGX Plan to Build Europe’s Largest Data Center
item.description: Nvidia Corp. and Abu Dhabi investment vehicle MGX are partnering with French firms to establish what they say will be Europe’s largest artificial intelligence data center campus, advancing French and Emirati ambitions in the field.
item.dc:creator: Omar El Chmouri

media:content.media:description: Bpifrance SACA CEO Nicolas Dufourcq, front centre left, MGX CEO Ahmed Yahia Al Isrissi, front centre right, Mistral AI CEO Arthur Mensch, front right, France’s Finance Minister Eric Lombard rear center, and Mubadala Investment Co.’s CEO Khaldoon Al Mubarak, rear right, in Versailles, on May 19.

item.title: Apple’s $100 Billion-a-Year App Store Will Never Be the Same
item.description: Apple’s $100 billion-a-year App Store business will never be the same again after getting upended by lawsuits. Also: Inside Apple’s artificial intelligence crisis and what comes next; new details on iOS 19, iPadOS 19 and visionOS 3; and CarPlay Ultra is finally ready — if you can afford it.
item.dc:creator: Mark Gurman

media:content.media:description: The Apple App Store app on a smartphone arranged in New York, US, on Tuesday, June 25, 2024. Apple Inc. risks billions of euros of new fines over its App Store rules as European Union antitrust regulators escalated a growing conflict over rules that strike at the heart of the iPhone makers business model.

item.title: UK Legal Aid Hack Includes ‘Significant Amount’ of Personal Data
item.description: Hackers have stolen a “significant amount of personal data” from people who received legal aid across England and Wales, the UK’s Ministry of Justice said.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Gallagher

media:content.media:description: A contestant competes in a hacking contest Photographer: Yoshikazu Tsuno/Gamma-Rapho

item.title: Saudi Arabia, UAE See AI Buildup as Key to Post-Oil Power
item.description: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Omar El Chmouri analyzes the efforts by the Gulf states to gain powerful chips for artificial intelligence from leading US chipmakers.
item.dc:creator: Omar El Chmouri

media:content.media:description: RIYADH, SAUDI ARABIA - MAY 13: U.S. President Donald Trump meets with Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman as he arrives at King Khalid International Airport on May 13, 2025, in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. Trump begins a multi-nation tour of the Gulf region focused on expanding economic ties and reinforcing security cooperation with key U.S. allies. (Photo by Win McNamee/Getty Images)

item.title: Telefonica’s Latin America Fire-Sale Sends Chile Unit to New Low
item.description: Bonds of Telefonica Moviles Chile SA slumped into distressed territory last week on a report that its parent company was about to throw in the towel, selling the asset after years of fierce competition in the local mobile phone market.
item.dc:creator: Carolina Gonzalez

item.title: Huawei Unveils in-House Operating System to Replace Windows
item.description: Huawei Technologies Co. debuted its first in-house operating system for personal computers, offering an alternative to Microsoft Corp’s Windows as China pushes to replace American technologies amid rising geopolitical tensions.
item.dc:creator: Yuan Gao, Jessica Sui

media:content.media:description: The Huawei MateBook Fold. Photographer: Costfoto/NurPhoto/Getty Images

item.title: Anthropic Is Trying to Win the AI Race Without Losing Its Soul
item.description: Dario Amodei has transformed himself from an academic into the CEO of a $61 billion startup.
item.dc:creator: Shirin Ghaffary

media:content.media:description: Anthropic co-founder and CEO Dario Amodei at the startup’s offices in San Francisco.

item.title: Vodacom Eyes Africa Network Sharing as Payout Beats Forecast
item.description: Vodacom Group Ltd., Africa’s largest wireless carrier, declared a full-year dividend that beat analysts’ estimates and outlined plans for network sharing agreements across the region.
item.dc:creator: Loni Prinsloo

media:content.media:description: A Vodacom Group store in Pretoria, South Africa.

item.title: Xiaomi Aims to Spend $7 Billion on Building Own Chip This Decade
item.description: Xiaomi Corp. is planning to invest at least 50 billion yuan ($6.9 billion) in developing its own mobile processor over a decade to grow its semiconductor clout, as major tech companies increasingly treat chip knowhow as strategically important.
item.dc:creator: Debby Wu

media:content.media:description: The Xiaomi Corp. logo.
